title: In Nicaragua, Holy week celebrations limited by government
description: Roman Catholics in Nicaragua have had to hold traditional “Stations of the Cross” and other Holy Week processions on church grounds or inside the churches amid a ban on public demonstrations

title: Hundreds of thousands still in dark from ice storm in Canada
description: Hundreds of thousands of people remain without power in eastern Canada two days after a storm left parts of Quebec and Ontario coated in ice, causing tree limbs to break and fall on power lines

title: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict: A chronology
description: Decades of conflict, tensions and the occasional hope for peace.

title: French winegrowers light candles to protect vines from spring frost
description: French winemakers scrambled this week amid subzero temperatures to light thousands of candles and protect their vines from a potentially devastating frost.

title: 3 killed in Northern Italy after car crashes into farm silo
description: Three people were killed at a farm in Northern Italy when their car crashed into a silo that collapsed and buried their vehicle under an enormous mound of chicken feed

title: Blast at north Iraqi airport raises tension in Kurdish area
description: Officials say an explosion has struck next to an international airport in northern Iraq’s semi-autonomous Kurdish region

title: One soldier killed, one wounded in explosion in western Russia
description: Amid reports of the strange blast in Bryansk near the Ukrainian border, Russia's finance ministry reported a steep drop in energy revenues.

title: Life sentences in Congo for killing of Italian ambassador
description: Six men in Congo were sentenced to life in prison on Friday for the murder of Italy’s ambassador and two others

title: Two Israeli sisters killed in West Bank shooting as violence escalates
description: The attack Friday, which Palestinian militant group Hamas celebrated, added to tensions as Israel and Palestinian militants exchanged rocket fire.

title: Paul Cattermole of UK pop group S Club 7 dies at 46
description: Paul Cattermole, a member of early-2000s British pop group S Club 7, has died at the age of 46

title: Violence spreads to West Bank as fears of regional conflict appear to fade
description: A nervous calm settled over Jerusalem Friday after a day of rocket fire and Israeli airstrikes, but a deadly shooting attack in the West Bank risked new escalation.

title: Farmers in Romania, Bulgaria protest Ukrainian grain influx
description: Farmers in Romania and Bulgaria are protesting over the European Union’s response to a glut of agricultural products from Ukraine that they say are flooding local markets and undercutting prices

title: 3 new 'Star Wars' movies coming, including Rey's return
description: For “Star Wars” lovers, new entertainment is a little less far, far away

title: Chinese Christian asylum seekers reported heading to US
description: A religious freedom activist says more than 60 asylum-seeking members of a Chinese Christian church who were detained last week in Thailand are en route to the United States

title: Police: Dissidents may try attacks as N. Ireland marks peace
description: Police have warned that armed dissident groups are planning violent attacks over the Easter holiday weekend as Northern Ireland marks 25 years since the peace accord that ended three decades of bloodshed

title: In Photos: Israel launches strikes on Lebanon and Gaza after rocket barrage
description: Friday prayers at al-Aqsa Mosque in occupied East Jerusalem began amid high tensions, after Israel carried out airstrikes in Lebanon and the Gaza Strip early Friday and the risk of a wide-scale regional conflict grew.

title: Greek far-right party seeks to defy election ban
description: A retired senior prosecutor in Greece has been named as the new leader of a far-right party as it seeks to sidestep a ban on its participation in an upcoming general election

title: Chinese man who chained, abused woman sentenced to 9 years
description: A Chinese court has sentenced a man to nine years in prison for abusing and unlawfully detaining a woman who was shown chained in a viral video that sparked an outcry in China last year

title: UK police charge 12-year-old with murder in car crash death
description: British police have charged a 12-year-old boy with murder after a car plowed into a woman on a city street in northern England

title: After Burkina Faso ousts French, Russia's Wagner may arrive
description: Months after hundreds of French troops left Burkina Faso, ousted by the ruling military junta, speculation is mounting that the war-torn nation will fill the void with fighters from Russia’s shadowy mercenary outfit, the Wagner Group

title: Israeli medics: 2 killed in Palestinian attack in West Bank
description: Israeli medics say an alleged Palestinian shooting attack in the northern occupied West Bank killed two women and seriously wounded another, the latest violence after Israeli warplanes struck southern Lebanon in a significant escalation

title: Pakistan's army says it has arrested Baluch insurgency chief
description: Pakistan’s military has arrested a high-value target in an operation against Baluch insurgent group in the country’s southwest

title: Israel strikes Lebanon, Gaza, as Al-Aqsa crisis escalates
description: Israel conducted rare airstrikes in Lebanon on Friday, a sharp escalation that sparked fears of a broader conflict after militants fired dozens of rockets from Lebanon into Israeli territory

title: Rohingya refugees brave perilous seas to escape camp desperation
description: At least 348 Rohingya died or went missing last year, the United Nations says, as they turned to smugglers to flee worsening conditions in the sprawling Bangladeshi camps.

title: Ukraine live briefing: No consular access for detained U.S. reporter; Europe urges China not to arm Russia
description: The White House said U.S. officials have not been granted consular access to Evan Gershkovich, the Wall Street Journal reporter detained in Russia.

title: Live Updates: Israel strikes sites in Lebanon and Gaza as tensions boil over
description: The strikes came after a barrage of rockets were fired from southern Lebanon toward northern Israel.

title: Why do Jerusalem tensions fuel regionwide unrest?
description: It’s become something of a grim, springtime tradition in the Holy Land

title: Filipinos to be nailed to crosses despite church objection
description: At least 12 Filipinos are to be nailed to crosses to reenact Jesus Christ’s suffering in a gory Good Friday tradition that is rejected by the Catholic church

title: Firefighters battle large blaze at sprawling Mexican market
description: Some 200 firefighters are battling a huge blaze in Mexico City’s sprawling wholesale market without any reported injuries

title: How Poland became the new ‘center of gravity’ in Europe
description: The war in Ukraine has ushered in a kind of geopolitical shift in Europe, away from its traditional anchors in France and Germany. In Central and Eastern Europe, wrote Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann, “the weight of history is stronger … the traumas are fresher and the return of tragedy is felt more keenly.”
